title: Motion and Measurement of Distances
description: Learn about different types of motion, measurement units, and methods of measuring distances.

questions.question: Which of these is a unit of length?
questions.explanation: Meter is the basic unit of length in the metric system, used to measure distances.

questions.question: What type of motion is shown by a pendulum?
questions.explanation: A pendulum shows oscillatory motion as it moves back and forth in a regular pattern.

questions.question: Which of these is used to measure small lengths?
questions.explanation: Vernier caliper is used to measure small lengths with high precision.

questions.question: What is the SI unit of length?
questions.explanation: Meter is the SI (International System of Units) unit of length.

questions.question: Which of these shows rectilinear motion?
questions.explanation: A moving car shows rectilinear motion as it moves in a straight line.

questions.question: What is used to measure long distances?
questions.explanation: Odometer is used to measure long distances, especially in vehicles.

questions.question: Which of these shows circular motion?
questions.explanation: A rotating fan shows circular motion as it moves in a circular path.

questions.question: What is the relationship between meter and centimeter?
questions.explanation: 1 meter is equal to 100 centimeters in the metric system.

questions.question: Which of these shows periodic motion?
questions.explanation: A swinging pendulum shows periodic motion as it repeats its motion at regular intervals.

questions.question: What is used to measure the length of a curved line?
questions.explanation: A string and ruler can be used to measure the length of a curved line by placing the string along the curve and then measuring its length.
